caption.p: β-Caryophyllene mechanism of action. Time course curves ( A) and dose–response in the neurogenic ( B) and inflammatory ( C) effects of β-caryophyllene (10 mg/kg, intraperitoneally (i.p.)) alone and in the presence of one antagonist: naloxone (NLX, 1 mg/kg, i.p.), flumazenil (FMZ, 10 mg/kg, i.p.), WAY100635 (0.16 mg/kg, subcutaneously (s.c.)), or the nitric oxide synthase inhibitor L-NAME (20 mg/kg i.p.). Each point or column is the average ± standard error of at least six repetitions. Two-way ANOVA followed by Tukey´s post hoc test. *** p < 0.001 vs. Veh; &&& p < 0.001 vs. β-caryophyllene. One-way ANOVA followed by Dunnett´s test. * p < 0.05, *** p < 0.001 vs. Veh; # p < 0.05, ## p < 0.01, ### p < 0.001 vs. β-caryophyllene.
